utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: The casino, Ross and Rachel are entering.]

utterances.transcript: I think the check in is that way.
utterances.transcript_with_note: I think the check in is that way. (Points)

utterances.transcript: Ahh.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (A young boy sees Rachel, points, and starts laughing.)

utterances.transcript: Hello! Ohh, kids love me.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Hello! (She makes a face and the kid laughs harder. Finally, his parents drag him off.) Ohh, kids love me.

utterances.transcript: Hey!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (sees Ross and Rachel) Hey!

utterances.transcript: Phoebe!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Phoebe! (They hug.)

utterances.transcript: You guys are here! Yay!
Hi!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Hi! (Hugs Phoebe)

utterances.transcript: What? Did you go to a costume party? Let me guess umm Pancho Vila? and you're Bob Saget.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (sees Rachel's face) What? Did you go to a costume party? Let me guess umm Pancho Vila? (Points at Rachel) and you're Bob Saget. (An old lady has sat down at the slot machine Phoebe was just at.)

utterances.transcript: Pancho Vila?
Yeah!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yeah! (Motions to her face, indicating all of Rachel's "make-up.")

utterances.transcript: What are you talking about Pheebs? I don't... Oh my God, you drew on me?!
utterances.transcript_with_note: What are you talking about Pheebs? (Takes out her compact) I don't... (She gasps when she looks in the mirror and sees her face.) (To Ross) Oh my God, you drew on me?!

utterances.transcript: Hey, you wet my pants!
Whoa, what kind of party was this?
Ross, I have been walking around like this since the plane! I can-you have so crossed a line.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Ross, I have been walking around like this since the plane! I can-you have so crossed a line. (Heads for the bathroom)

utterances.transcript: Rach! Wait! The men's room is that way.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Rach! Wait! The men's room is that way. (Points in the other direction. Rachel hits him with her purse and heads for the ladies room.)
(The old lady at Phoebe's machine wins. Phoebe turns around in shock.)

utterances.transcript: Ugh!
What?
That's like the third time that lady's won on a machine I was playing.
Oooohhh, I'll bet she's one of those people.
M-M-Mole people?
What? No-no, a lurker.
Oh. What's a lurker?
Okay when you're playing a machine and it hasn't paid out, a lurker waits for you to give up and then...
Kills you?
No. They swoop in and steal your jackpot.
Ohhh!
Uh-hmm.
How do you know about this?
My nana used to do it. That's how she paid for all my dance-karate lessons.
Dance karate?
Yes, it's a deadly but beautiful sport.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yes, it's a deadly but beautiful sport. (Does a karate chop, then does a little dance-type sway.)

utterances.transcript: All right, it won't come off!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (returning with her purse covering her face) All right, it won't come off!

utterances.transcript: What?!
It won't come off!
Oh my God! Rach-Rach, are-are-are you sure?
No, actually I took it off then I drew it back on.
Hey-hey-hey you made it!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (entering) Hey-hey-hey you made it!

utterances.transcript: Joey!!
All right! Hey-hey!
Hi!!
Who's your friend? He's hot!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Who's your friend? He's hot! (Ross laughs and Rachel smacks him with her purse.)

utterances.transcript: Thanks man.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (To Joey) Thanks man.

utterances.transcript: Hi.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Hi. (She hugs Joey.)

utterances.transcript: Hey listen I uh, talked to Chandler, sorry about the movie.
No, don't be sorry. I don't need it anymore. I found my identical hand twin!
Your what?
My identical hand twin! The person whose hands are exactly like mine! This thing is a gold mine!
What?! That's not gonna make you any money!
Okay. Well, if that's how you feel about it, fine! None of you get to live with me in my great big hand-shaped mansion! Except uh, you Pheebs. You can live in the thumb.

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: The craps table, Monica is on a big roll.]

utterances.transcript: All right baby, come on! Yes! Yes! I am on fire!
utterances.transcript_with_note: All right baby, come on! (Rolls the dice) Yes! Yes! I am on fire!

utterances.transcript: See you later Mon.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (walking by with his luggage) See you later Mon.

utterances.transcript: Wait Chandler, what are you doing?!
What does it look like? I'm going home.

What? Wait! Why? Chandler! Chandler! Wait! I'm sorry, I was just playing for one second! I was trying to find you to tell you that, look if you don't want me to see Richard again, I won't! He means nothing to me!
utterances.transcript_with_note: What? Wait! Why? (He turns and heads for the door and she chases after him.) Chandler! Chandler! Wait! I'm sorry, I was just playing for one second! I was trying to find you to tell you that, look if you don't want me to see Richard again, I won't! He means nothing to me!

utterances.transcript: Come on! I was there! I know he's the love of your life.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Come on! I was there! (He's propped up with his hand on a statute of a naked guy. He winces and pulls his hand away.) I know he's the love of your life.

utterances.transcript: Not any more.
Really?!
Really! All right? Let's forget about this going home stuff and celebrate our anniversary. Okay, this is empty.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Really! (They hug and kiss) All right? Let's forget about this going home stuff and celebrate our anniversary. (She picks up his suitcase.) Okay, this is empty.

utterances.transcript: Yeah, I wanted to make a dramatic scene, but I hate packing.

plots: They make up , and Monica continues her winning streak playing craps .
Monica gambles instead of making up with Chandler .
Monica and Chandler make up when Monica tells Chandler Monica wo n't see Richard anymore and that Chandler is the love of her life .

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: A blackjack table, it's the same one Joey's hand twin was working at, only he's not there anymore and has been replaced by a beautiful woman.]

utterances.transcript: Uhh, hey. Where's the other guy?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (entering) Uhh, hey. Where's the other guy?

utterances.transcript: Which guy?
He's kinda tall, dark hair, hand looks exactly like this. See?
utterances.transcript_with_note: He's kinda tall, dark hair, hand looks exactly like this. (Holds up his hand.) See?

utterances.transcript: I don't know about the hands, but the guy that was here before me just went to the bathroom.
Okay! How you doin'?
utterances.transcript_with_note: Okay! (Walks away, then turns back.) How you doin'?

utterances.transcript: Very busy.
Right! Okay.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Right! Okay. (Heads for the bathroom.)

[Scene: Ross and Rachel's hotel room, Rachel is still trying to get the ink off and Ross is on the phone to the company. Wait a minute, why exactly are they sharing a hotel room? Didn't they like break-up or something? Did I miss a memo? Or maybe, it's just foreshadowing things to come. Who knows? Maybe the answer's at the bottom of the page. Then again, maybe it isn't and it's just one of those things TV writers just don't explain. Anyhoo...]

utterances.transcript: Yes, hello. I have a question. Umm, I used your pen to draw on my friend's face. A beard and a moustache. Thank you. No, she didn't think so. I know it's like anyway, umm well make-up didn't cover it and we've tried everything to get it off and nothing's worked. What-what do we do? Yeah. Uh-huh. Yeah. Oh! Okay. Okay, thank you! Yeah, it's not coming off.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (on the phone) Yes, hello. I have a question. Umm, I used your pen to draw on my friend's face. (Listens) A beard and a moustache. (Listens and laughs) Thank you. (Rachel turns around and glares at him.) No, she didn't think so. (Listens) I know it's like (turns and sees Rachel staring at him and quickly changes the subject) anyway, umm well make-up didn't cover it and we've tried everything to get it off and nothing's worked. What-what do we do? (Listens) Yeah. (Listens) Uh-huh. (Listens) Yeah. (Listens) Oh! Okay. (Listens) Okay, thank you! (Rachel gets excited at his tone.) (Hangs up the phone) Yeah, it's not coming off.

utterances.transcript: What?! What else did he say?
Umm, he said he thought I was funny. So... Okay, look-look umm, let's just go downstairs, we'll have some fun, and you will forget all about it.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Umm, he said he thought I was funny. So...(Rachel stares at him.) Okay, look-look umm, let's just go downstairs, we'll have some fun, and you will forget all about it.

utterances.transcript: Ross, no! There is no way I am leaving this room looking like this!
Oh, come on! Rach, it's-it's not that bad.
Ross, I am a human doodle!!

Look, just because some idiot drew on your face doesn't mean you shouldn't have any fun! Okay? And besides, hey-hey-hey no one is even gonna look at you. Okay? This is Vegas! Hello! There are tons of other freaks here! There are tons...of...freaks here. No other. No. Come on! No one will notice, I swear!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Look, just because some idiot drew on your face doesn't mean you shouldn't have any fun! Okay? And besides, hey-hey-hey no one is even gonna look at you. Okay? This is Vegas! Hello! There are tons of other freaks here! (Rachel turns around and glares at him.) There are tons...of...freaks here. No other. No. Come on! No one will notice, I swear!
(They both exit.)
[Time lapse, they're both entering.]

utterances.transcript: Okay, there was some staring and pointing.
Okay, I need a, I need a drink!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Okay, I need a, I need a drink! (Makes a beeline for the mini-bar.)

utterances.transcript: Oh, hey y'know, they-they really overcharge you for that stuff. But who cares?! Because it's all on me! That is, one big drink!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh, hey y'know, they-they really overcharge you for that stuff. (Rachel glares at him.) But who cares?! Because it's all on me! (Rachel reaches into the fridge and pulls out two handfuls of those mini booze bottles.) (Watching her.) That is, one big drink!

utterances.transcript: Macadamia nut?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (she's finished reliving the fridge of its entire alcohol content.) Macadamia nut?

utterances.transcript: Umm... Wow! That's-that's some pricey nut!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (looking at the price list) Umm... Wow! That's-that's some pricey nut!

utterances.transcript: Hm-mmm!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Hm-mmm! (Opens the container)

utterances.transcript: Really like those Macadamia nuts, huh?
Nope!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Nope! (She puts one in her mouth and spits it out, then does it again in another direction.)

plots: While Rachel is sleeping Ross draws a beard and a mustache on her face .
Rachel tries to get the ink off her face but it wo nt come off , Ross calls the company but gets no solution to get it off .

Somebody drew on Rachel 's face and she is unwilling to go downstairs .
Rachel is really upset because it wo n't come off .
Ross called the Company .

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: The casino, Phoebe is playing on a slot machine. Suddenly the lurker sticks her head around the aisle of slot machines.]

utterances.transcript: Get out of here you lurker! Go on! Get!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (seeing her) Get out of here you lurker! (She doesn't move) Go on! Get! (She throws a quarter at her.)

utterances.transcript: Hey Pheebs!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (arm-in-arm with Monica) Hey Pheebs!

utterances.transcript: Ohh! You made up!
Yeah, I couldn't be mad at him for too long.
Yeah, she couldn't live without the Chan Love.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yeah, she couldn't live without the Chan Love. (They start kissing.)

utterances.transcript: Ohh, get a room.
We have one.
I know. Use it.

plots: Phoebe runs into Monica and Chandler in the casino and finds out they made up .
Phoebe talks to Monica and Chandler in the casino and gets grossed out by their kissing .

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: The Men's room, Joey is entering and sees his hand twin washing his hands.]

utterances.transcript: Oh-oh-oh, yeah! That's right, you take good care of those babies!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh-oh-oh, yeah! (He grabs some towels and takes them to him.) That's right, you take good care of those babies!

utterances.transcript: Excuse me?
It's me, Joey!
Do I know you?
Joey!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (holds up his hand) Joey!

utterances.transcript: Oh-ho, yeah. Yeah, the hand guy.
Okay, so what are we going to do about this hand twin thing?!
Nothing?
Look, you and I have been given a gift. Okay? We have to do something with it. Like-like, hand modeling! Huh? Or-or magic! And you know NASA's gonna wanna talk to us!
I have to get back to...
utterances.transcript_with_note: (tries to leave) I have to get back to...

utterances.transcript: Whoa! Whoa! Whoa! Whoa-whoa! We could have our own show! Y'know we could clap our hands together people will love it! Huh? And-and-and I wrote a song for us! This hand is your hand! This hand is my hand! Oh wait, that's your hand! No wait, it's my hand!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (stopping him) Whoa! Whoa! Whoa! Whoa-whoa! We could have our own show! Y'know we could clap our hands together people will love it! Huh? And-and-and I wrote a song for us! (Singing, to the tune of This Land is Your Land) This hand is your hand! This hand is my hand! Oh wait, that's your hand! No wait, it's my hand!

utterances.transcript: That's okay.
utterances.transcript_with_note: That's okay. (Walks out.)

utterances.transcript: But you haven't even heard the chorus!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (following him) But you haven't even heard the chorus!
[Scene: Ross and Rachel's room, Ross is drinking a beer while Rachel is examining herself in the mirror.]

utterances.transcript: Oh my God, I'm starting to look like my great aunt, Muriel.
All right. Y'know what? We don't have to go downstairs! We can bring Vegas up to us! All right, come on, come on, we'll play some blackjack. Here we go. 13.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (gets up) All right. Y'know what? We don't have to go downstairs! We can bring Vegas up to us! (He grabs a deck of cards and pulls up a chair.) All right, come on, come on, we'll play some blackjack. Here we go. (Deals the cards.) 13.

utterances.transcript: Hit me!
Oohh, 23. Which is what we play to at this casino! You win 10 dollars!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (does so) Oohh, 23. (Rachel looks at him.) Which is what we play to at this casino! You win 10 dollars! (Holds out a ten.)

utterances.transcript: I bet 20.
You're right!
utterances.transcript_with_note: You're right! (Gives her the twenty she won.)

plots: Rachel does n't want to leave Rachel 's room so Ross and Rachel get drunk and play blackjack in Ross ' room .
Rachel and Ross play blackjack .

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: The Craps Table, Monica is still on her roll, only this time Chandler's with her and she has a huge crowd of people around.]

utterances.transcript: A new pair of shoes for the Chan-Chan man! Yes!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (shaking the dice) A new pair of shoes for the Chan-Chan man! (Rolls the dice.) Yes!

utterances.transcript: Yes! I've-I've never seen a roll like this in my life!
That's right baby! Okay, what do I want now?
Okay, ah umm, ah, a 8. Ah, a 6?
Pick a number! That is your only job!
Thank you!
If you get this one, we buy everybody here a steak dinner!
Yay!!
Yes!
Yay!!
We're not really gonna buy these people steak dinners are we?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (To Chandler) We're not really gonna buy these people steak dinners are we?

utterances.transcript: Noo!
Okay, good! Okay, what do I want now?
Ahh, ooh, try a hard 8.
What?
Two fours.
Okay.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Okay. (Rolls the dice)

utterances.transcript: Don't you let her go! You're a lucky guy!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (To Chandler) Don't you let her go! You're a lucky guy!

utterances.transcript: Thank you, Mister Drunken Gambler! Okay, you get this and uh, we get the biggest suite in the place! Wait-wait-wait-wait! We get the biggest suite in the place.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Thank you, Mister Drunken Gambler! Okay, you get this and uh, we get the biggest suite in the place! (Everyone cheers) Wait-wait-wait-wait! We (motions to Monica and him.) get the biggest suite in the place.

utterances.transcript: All right, biggest suite in the place. Come on!
utterances.transcript_with_note: All right, biggest suite in the place. Come on! (Rolls the dice.)

utterances.transcript: Yes!! I love you! I can't even remember what we were fighting about!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (sees the roll) Yes!! I love you! I can't even remember what we were fighting about!

utterances.transcript: Oh, that's because I had lunch with Rich-Me neither! Okay, what do I want now?
Another hard 8.
Hard 8?! We should call it easy 8!
Okay, okay, I tell you what. You roll another hard eight; and we get married here tonight.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Okay, okay, I tell you what. You roll another hard eight; (pause) and we get married here tonight.

utterances.transcript: Go! Come on! Roll!
Roll-roll!!
Shut up!! It just got interesting!

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: The Craps table, continued from earlier.]

utterances.transcript: What did you just say?
You roll another hard eight and we get married here tonight.
Are you serious?!
Yes! I love you! I've never loved anybody as much as I love you.
I've never loved anybody as much as I love you.

Okay, so if an eight comes up, we take it as a sign and we do it! {Whoa! Where have I heard that before? Matthew Perry talking about signs in Las Vegas. I guess it must've been some movie I saw.} What do you say?
Okay!
Okay! Come on! Let's go! All right!

utterances.transcript_with_note: (She rolls the dice, but one bounces out of the table.)

utterances.transcript: Okay! That's a four! And where-where's the other one?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (spots one) Okay! That's a four! And where-where's the other one?

utterances.transcript: It went under the table.
Nobody move! Okay, you look that way; I'll look this way!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Nobody move! (To Chandler) Okay, you look that way; I'll look this way!

utterances.transcript: All right!

utterances.transcript_with_note: (He searches to his right; she searches to her left. They're both on their hands and knees when they spot the die. It's propped up against the table leg, and it's not lying flat. Both the four and the five are showing.)

utterances.transcript: Here it is! Here it is!
That could be a four or a five. It's your call.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Pause.)

utterances.transcript: It's a four.
I think so too.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Cue up the music as they move in and kiss. This time I think it's Perry Como, but I'm not sure. It's Everybody loves somebody, sometime! Everybody falls in love somehow! Something in your kiss, just told me, my sometime, is now!)

plots: Chandler says if Monica rolls another hard eight , they 'll get married .
Monica and Chandler are at the casino . They determine whether they will get married based on the roll of the dice .
Monica throws a dice to decide whether or not a marraige is going to happen .

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: The slot machines, Phoebe is still feeding quarters into the one-armed bandit as the lurker peeks over the top of the machines.]

utterances.transcript: Oh well, lost again. That's it! You and me, outside!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh well, lost again. (She gets up and slowly moves away. The lurker scurries in and takes her spot, only this time Phoebe set a trap for her and catches her in the act.) That's it! You and me, outside!

utterances.transcript: I don't want to see you lose a chunk of that pretty blond hair!

utterances.transcript_with_note: (They start smacking each other's cups, but Phoebe notices a security guard approaching.)

utterances.transcript: Be cool! Okay lady, your lurking days are over!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Be cool! (They both pretend to have a nice conversation as the guard walks by, but after he leaves they both start fighting again.) Okay lady, your lurking days are over!

utterances.transcript: What?!

Yeah, from now on everyone you lurk, I'm gonna lurk first! You move on to someone else, I'm gonna be one step ahead of you, every single time! And then I'll be on your ass every hour of every day 'til Monday, because that's when I go home. When do you leave?
Also Monday.
What time? Maybe we can share a cab!

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Ross and Rachel's room, they've pretty much consumed the entire mini-bar. Needless to say, they're feeling no pain and are still playing blackjack.]

utterances.transcript: Hit me. Hit me. Hit me. Hit me. Hit me. Hit me. Hit me.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Hit me. (He does so.) Hit me. (He does so.) Hit me. (He does so.) Hit me. (He does so.) Hit me. (He does so.) Hit me. (He does so.) Hit me. (She slows down with each one.)

utterances.transcript: We need more cards.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (runs out of cards) We need more cards.

utterances.transcript_with_note: Yeah, and also we need more umm, drinks. Hold on a second. (Gets up but stumbles a little bit.) Whup, okay. (She makes it to the phone and picks it up, without dialing.) Hello! Vegas? Yeah, we would like some more alcohol, and y'know what else? We would like some more beers. Hello? Ohh, I forgot to dial!
(They both start laughing. There's a knock on the door.)

utterances.transcript: That must be our alcohol and beers!
utterances.transcript_with_note: That must be our alcohol and beers! (Gets up to answer it.)

utterances.transcript: Hey!
Ohh, it's Joey! I love Joey!

utterances.transcript_with_note: Ohh, I love Joey! Joey lives with a duck! (Goes and hugs Joey.)

utterances.transcript: Hi!
Hey!
Look-look-look you guys, I need some help! Okay? Someone is going to have to convince my hand twin to cooperate!
I'll do it. Hey, whatever you need me to do, I'm your man. Whoa-oh-whoa! Are you, are you okay?

Needless to say, he misses and falls on his butt.) (Looking up at Joey.) Whoa-oh-whoa! Are you, are you okay?

utterances.transcript: Yeah! I'm fine! Thanks! Hey Rach, how you doin'?

Ross, don't let her drink anymore!

utterances.transcript: Ohh, here's that Macadamia nut!
Ohhh!!
Nope! Something else.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (he puts it in his mouth) Nope! Something else. (Throws it back under the bed.)

utterances.transcript: Oops! All right, so what do you want to do now?
I wanna get out of the room! Y'know, I...I really miss downstairs.
Okay, y'know what? There's only one way I'm leaving this hotel room.

Ross has some whiskers and his nose colored in, along with his name on his forehead.]

utterances.transcript: Well hello! I'm Ross!
Good luck to ya!
Excuse me sir, you've got a little something right here.

Hello!

utterances.transcript_with_note: (bowing) Hello!

utterances.transcript: Hello!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (bowing) Hello!

[Scene: The slot machines, we see some guy not having any luck. Both Phoebe and the Lurker are lurking him and each stick their heads around the corner at different times This is all set to that Pink Panther song. Finally the guy gives up and walks past the lurker's position, thus giving her the advantage. She scurries in and quickly drops a coin in the slot before Phoebe gets there. Phoebe arrives slightly later and pulls the arm just after the lurker deposits the coin and wins.]

utterances.transcript: I won! I won! I finally won!
I won! That was my quarter!
Fine! Here! Take a hike toots!

(The security guard approaches.)

utterances.transcript: Is that true miss?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (To Phoebe) Is that true miss?

utterances.transcript: Sells drugs to kids.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (quietly) Sells drugs to kids.

She sells drugs to kids.
utterances.transcript_with_note: She sells drugs to kids. (The guard looks at the lurker.)

utterances.transcript: It was my quarter!
Was it her quarter?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (To Phoebe) Was it her quarter?

Okay lady, you're out of here.
No! No, you can't arrest me! No!! I won't go back! I won't go back to that hell hole!!
I'm just taking you outside!
Oh, okay.

[Scene: The Gift Shop, Monica and Chandler are entering.]

utterances.transcript: Okay, come on, I can't get married until I get something old, something new, something borrowed, and something blue.
Okay, all right, all right, all right! Okay! Okay, here's something, here's something blue and new.

Let's go!

Ohh, great, I have condom in my wallet I've had since I was twelve.
That'll work!
I don't think so.
Okay, now we just need something borrowed!
Here just...take this.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (looks around) Here just...take this. (Hands her the sweater.)

utterances.transcript: That's stealing!
No, we'll-we'll bring it back! Just put it under your dress.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (She does so and it makes her look pregnant.)

utterances.transcript: Ohh.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Ohh. (Rubs her fake stomach.)

utterances.transcript: Okay, one thing at a time.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Okay, one thing at a time. (They run out to get married.)

plots: Chandler is trying to hurry Monica to get the things Monica 's wants for the bride 's outfit .
Chandler and Monica are at a store trying to find items to fulfill the wedding " requirements " .

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: A blackjack table, Joey is moving in to try and get his hand twin (who's dealing) to join him in his evil plot to rule the world! "Join me, and together we'll rule the universe as father and son!" (Sorry, I had a little Star Wars creep in there-Ooh, I have a big spoiler for The Phantom Menace, Yoda lives at the end! Ha-ha, spoiled it! Now you don't have to see it!)]

utterances.transcript: Ahhh!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (sitting down) Ahhh! (Slides his hands across the table.)

utterances.transcript: Are you gonna play?
No-no, I don't really have any money. Not yet, anyway...
utterances.transcript_with_note: No-no, I don't really have any money. Not yet, anyway... (Shakes his hands.)

utterances.transcript: You can't sit here if you're not gonna play.
Ooh-ho-ho!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (throws down a small wad of money, and as his hand twin starts to unfold it, Joey once again brings attention to their special gift to the world. {Y'know, looking at it now, they really don't have that similar of hands. Joey's are bigger.}) Ooh-ho-ho! (The dealer stares at him and he stops.)

utterances.transcript: Hello. My name is Regina Phalange. I'm a businesswoman in town on business. Would you like to see my card? Ooh, what did I do with my file-a-facts? I must've left it in conference room B.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (entering and sitting down at the table.) Hello. My name is Regina Phalange. I'm a businesswoman in town on business. Would you like to see my card? (Looks down) Ooh, what did I do with my file-a-facts? I must've left it in conference room B.
(To Joey) 14.

utterances.transcript: Hit me!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Hit me! (He does so.)

utterances.transcript: Oh my God! May I just say that you two gentlemen have the exact same hands! They're identical! Now, I've never seen anything like that in the business world.
Stop it!
Uhh, Ms. Phalange, may I ask you a question as an impartial person at-at this table?
Please stop it!
Wouldn't you pay good money to see these identical hands showcased in some type of a uh, entertainment venue?
If you leave now, I will chop off my hand and give it too you!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (To Joey) If you leave now, I will chop off my hand and give it too you!
(The security guard from before approaches and Phoebe tries to turn her back on him.)

utterances.transcript: Didn't I just throw you out of here?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (To Phoebe) Didn't I just throw you out of here?

utterances.transcript: No, you threw out Phoebe. I'm Ms. Regina Phalange. Phalange!
Come on, lady!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Come on, lady! (Starts to escort her out.)

utterances.transcript: Please, please take him too.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Please, please take him too. (Motions to Joey.)

utterances.transcript: Me?! Oh come on, man! You can't do this! Come on! I'm your hand twin!!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Me?! Oh come on, man! You can't do this! Come on! (Being dragged out by the guard) I'm your hand twin!!

plots: Joey tries to persuade his identical hand twin that Joey and his identical hand twin should go into show business .

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: A Little White Chapel, Chandler and Monica are entering.]

utterances.transcript: Hello! One marriage please!
Yep, we wanna get married!
Well, there's a service in progress. Have a seat.
All right.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (They both sit down.)

utterances.transcript: Dum! Dum-dum-dum! Dum! Dum! Dum! Dum-dum-dum!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (singing) Dum! Dum-dum-dum! Dum! Dum! Dum! Dum-dum-dum!

utterances.transcript: What are you doing?
Oh, that's The Wedding March. Does, does that freak you out?
No, only because that's the graduation song.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (The real Wedding March begins playing from behind the closed doors of the chapel.)

utterances.transcript: Okay! This is it! We're gonna get married!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Okay! (Stands up) This is it! (Claps his hands) We're gonna get married!

utterances.transcript: Are you sure you wanna do this?

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Suddenly the doors burst open, and ROSS AND RACHEL COME OUT ARM-IN-ARM!!!!! And Rachel's carrying a bouquet!!! THEY GOT MARRIED!!!!)

utterances.transcript: Well, hello, Mrs. Ross!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Well, hello, Mrs. Ross! (Throws some rice.)

utterances.transcript: Well, hello, Mr. Rachel!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Well, hello, Mr. Rachel! (Throws some more rice.)
(They storm out into the street.)

utterances.transcript: Wait! Okay!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Wait! (Gets her bearings) Okay!

(She goes one way; he goes the other. The camera pans back to Chandler and Monica, and needless to say, they're standing there dumbstruck as The King's (Elvis Presley to the yougin's) Viva, Las Vegas begins to play. Sing along with me now, "Viva! Las Vegas! Vivaaaaaa! Vivaaaaa! Las Vegassssss!!" Fade to Black.)
End

plots: They arrive at the wedding chapel and are waiting for the previous service to end , when the chapel doors fly open and out walk the drunken Ross and Rachel , newly married .
When Chandler and Monica go to get married , Rachel and Ross come out of the chapel very drunk - and married !
